result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon B Boand

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandon B Boand in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case dismissed and read into 15CM1201.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon B Boand in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises he has a possible resolution but they are still working on obtaining evidence requested by the State.  Attorney Kershek moves for an adjournment.  Court sets this case for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon B Boand in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Brandon B Boand in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

BAIL SET AT $1000.00
Warrant signed by Judge Carter
